creator: danny-apache-bugs@sadinoff.com
text:
forgot the parens.  That should be 
  new Perl5Util().split(tokenList,"");

Current behavior is intended, but deviates from Perl.  We're debating
the appropriate action on oro-dev.  Will probably make Perl5Util match
Perl's "leading empty fields are preserved, and empty trailing one are
deleted." rule which appears to take precedence over "If the PATTERN 
doesn't match at all, it returns the original string."  However, we
will probably leave org.apache.oro.text.regex.Util.split() alone and
add documentation explaining the difference in behavior.  Util.split()
is to be self-consistent and predictable with no special cases;
Perl5Util.split() is to be compatible with Perl's split.

Even though this was a simple test case, please include working example
code in future bug reports (e.g., there is no List.length()) to make
our jobs easier.  We all volunteer our time and anything that reduces
the time we have to spend diagnosing a problem is greatly appreciated
and improves the chances of a speedy resolution.
creator: dfs@apache.org
dfs@apache.org
text:
Just wanted to indicate this report has not been forgotten.  We have agreed
on the following corrective action and I expect to have time to make the change
this weekend:

Change Perl5Util.split() to fully conform with
Perl because that's what it claims to do and Perl5Util is intended to
match Perl's behavior, however inconsistent it may be.
Leave Util.split() alone and document the added differences in
behavior.

creator: dfs@apache.org
text:
Changed behavior of Perl5Util.split() to match Perl's  behavior, where
"leading empty fields are preserved, and empty trailing one are
deleted."  We apologize to the original reporter for taking so long to do 
this and request that he verify the fix before we close this bug report.
